info.title: Uberoo API
info.description:
To manage restaurants, menus, delivery people and orders with the Uberoo REST API.  
You can find out more about Uberoo at [uberoo.eat](https://uberoo.eat) and developer documentation at [developers.uberoo.eat](https://developers.uberoo.eat).

# Authentication
## Bearer
To authenticate you need to send a `Bearer <JWT>` token in the `Authorization` header.  
To find more information about JWT, you can find out more at [https://jwt.io](https://jwt.io).  
You can generate a JWT token using the `/account/login` endpoint.

tags.name: foods
tags.description: Manage foods and menus of restaurants

tags.name: accounts
tags.description: Manage accounts : authentication, registration, reset password

tags.name: users
tags.description: Manage users of Uberoo. Theses endpoints are for all users. Check specific type user for more information

tags.name: notifications
tags.description: Manage all notifications, including push notifications, email, SMS and Webhook

get.description: Retrieve all the information about all the restaurants

parameters.name: is_open
parameters.description: Filter restaurants by their open status (based on the current time)

204.description: The query was successful but no restaurants were found

post.description: Create a new restaurant. The restaurant will be returned in the response

tag.description: A list of tag of the restaurant

openingHours.description: The opening hours of the restaurant

items.description: Format day:hour with 0 for monday and 0,23 for hours

get.description: Retrieve all the information about a given restaurant by its id

200.description: Expected respaonse to a valid request

delete.description: Deletes the restaurant with the specified ID

patch.description: Update the restaurant with the specified ID

get.summary: Get the cart of the user passed in the path
get.description: Retrieve all the information about a given user's cart

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

post.summary: Add a item to the cart
post.description: Add a food item to the cart of the user passed in the path

foodId.description: The id of the food to add. Check Food schema for more information.

201.description: The food item has been added to the cart

put.summary: Update or create the cart of the user passed in the path
put.description:
Update or create the cart of the user passed in the path and return the updated cart.
If an item does not exist, it will be created.
If an item exists, it will be updated.
If an item is not present (anymore) in the list, it will be deleted.

delete.summary: Empty the cart of a user
delete.description: Delete the cart of the user with the specified ID

get.summary: Get all foods in a restaurant
get.description: Recovers the list of all foods and menu associated with a specific restaurant

parameters.name: is_gluten_free
parameters.description: Filter foods by their gluten-free status

parameters.name: is_vegetarian
parameters.description: Filter foods by their vegetarian status

parameters.name: is_vegan
parameters.description: Filter foods by their vegan status

parameters.name: is_lactose_free
parameters.description: Filter foods by their lactose-free status

200.description: A list of foods associated with the restaurant

204.description: The query was successful but no foods were found

205.description: A partial list of foods associated with the restaurant

post.description: Creates a new food associated with a restaurant

name.description: The name of the food, can be a menu

isGlutenFree.description: Indicates if the food is gluten free

isVegetarian.description: Indicates if the food is vegetarian

isVegan.description: Indicates if the food is vegan

put.description:
Updates the list of foods associated with a restaurant.
If a food is not present in the list, it will be deleted.

get.description: Retrieve all the information about a given food

delete.description: Delete a food item with the specified ID from the restaurant

patch.description: Update a food item for the restaurant

get.description: Retrieve all the information about orders according to the query parameters. You can use the 'filter' parameter to filter the results.

parameters.name: restaurantId
parameters.description: Filter orders by their restaurant id

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: Filter orders by their customer id

204.description: The query was successful but no orders were found

post.description: Create a new order. The order will be returned in the response

customerId.description: The id of the customer who made the order.

restaurantId.description: The id of the restaurant that serves the food

foods.description: The list of foods id in the order

deliveryAddress.example: Pl. du Maréchal de Lattre de Tassigny, 75016 Paris

409.description: The resource you want to update is in conflict

example.details: There is a request conflicts with the current state of the server

get.description: Retrieve all the information about a given order by its id

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to retrieve. Check Order schema for more information.

200.description: Expected respaonse to a valid request

delete.description: Deletes the order with the specified ID. You must have the permission to delete the order

patch.description: Update the order with the specified ID

foods.description: The list of foods id in the order

deliveryAddress.example: Pl. du Maréchal de Lattre de Tassigny, 75016 Paris

courierId.description: The id of the courier who is handling the order. By default, the order is not handled.

acceptedAt.description: The date of the creation of the order

preparingTime.description: The time it takes to prepare the order (in minutes)

deliveryTime.description: The time it takes to deliver the order to the customer (in minutes)

deliveredAt.description: The date of the delivery of the order

canceledAt.description: The date of the cancellation of the order. By default, the order is not canceled.

paymentId.description: The payment of the order (by default, the order is not paid)

post.description: Register a new user to Uberoo

type.description: Valid values are User's type. Depending on the type of account to be created, the user must have certain rights.For example, a customer account cannot create an admin account.

201.description: Registration successful, return a User object with a JWT token

post.description: Login with email and password to get a JWT token

get.description: Retrieve all the information about users according to the query parameters. You can use the 'filter' parameter to filter the results.

parameters.name: nearest
parameters.description: Filter the resource by their distance from a specified location. The specified location is specified by longitude and latitude. The distance is specified in meters.

schema.description: The longitude and latitude of the location to use as the center of the search. The longitude is in the range [-180,180] and the latitude is in the range [-90,90]. The default is the current location of the client.

204.description: The query was successful but no users were found

get.description: Retrieve all the information about a given user by its id

200.description: Expected respaonse to a valid request

delete.description: Deletes the user with the specified ID. You must have the permission to delete the user

patch.description: Update the user with the specified ID

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

type.description: The type of the user. You need to have the right to update this field.

address.example: Pl. du Maréchal de Lattre de Tassigny, 75016 Paris

restaurantId.name: restaurantId
restaurantId.description: The id of the restaurant to retrieve. Check Restaurant schema for more information.

userId.name: userId
userId.description:
The id of the user to retrieve.
It exist a special value "me" that can be used to retrieve the current user.
Check User schema for more information.

foodId.name: foodId
foodId.description: The id of the food to retrieve. Check Food schema for more information.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The numbers of items to return

order.name: order
order.description: The order of returned data (asc or desc)

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
The (advanced) filter to apply to the data (e.g. 'name:John'). We can use :
- `or` operator to combine filters (e.g. 'name:John or name:Doe').
- `and` operator to combine filters (e.g. 'name:Doe and firstname:John').
- `*` wildcard operator to match any string (e.g. 'name:John\*' will match 'John' and 'John Doe')
- `!` operator to negate a filter (e.g. '!name:John' will match all records except 'John')
- `>` operator to get records with a value greater than a given value (e.g. 'name:John>10' will match records with a name greater than 'John' and 'John Doe')
- `<` operator to get records with a value less than a given value (e.g. 'name:John<10' will match records with a name less than 'John' and 'John Doe')
- `>=` operator to get records with a value greater than or equal to a given value (e.g. 'name:John>=10' will match records with a name greater than or equal to 'John' and 'John Doe')
- `<=` operator to get records with a value less than or equal to a given value (e.g. 'name:John<=10' will match records with a name less than or equal to 'John' and 'John Doe')

schema.example: (firstname:John or firstname:Kevin) and age:>18 and name:Du*t

tag.description: A list of tag of the restaurant

openingHours.description: The opening hours of the restaurant

items.description: Format day:hour with 0 for monday and 0,23 for hours

Cart.description: The cart of the user who can be only a 'consumer'

items.description: The list of items to order

total.description: The total price of the basket

createdAt.description: The date of creation of the basket

updatedAt.description: The date of update of the basket

firstName.description: The first name of the user

lastName.description: The last name of the user

createdAt.description: The date of creation of the user

isAvailable.description: The availability of the user, can be true only if the user is a courier

orders.description: The list of orders of the user, can be filled only if the user is a consumer/merchant/courier

Order.description:
Represents a food.  
When a food is added to the cart, and the customer validate the order, a new order is create.

customerId.description: The id of the customer who made the order.

courierId.description: The id of the courier who is handling the order. By default, the order is not handled.

restaurantId.description: The id of the restaurant that serves the food

foods.description: The list of foods in the order

total.description: The total price of the order

acceptedAt.description: The date of the creation of the order

preparingTime.description: The time it takes to prepare the order (in minutes)

deliveryTime.description: The time it takes to deliver the order to the customer (in minutes)

deliveredAt.description: The date of the delivery of the order

canceledAt.description: The date of the cancellation of the order. By default, the order is not canceled.

paymentId.description: The payment of the order (by default, the order is not paid)
